table.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: The logical name of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.

description.value: EHDS refined base model for Health provider or any other type of organisation

definition.value: EHDS refined base model for Health provider or any other type of organisation

Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Telecommunication contact information (addresses) associated with a person, such as phone number, email, or messaging service. Multiple telecommunication addresses might be provided.
The organisation of which this organisation forms a part

The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. Telecommunication contact information (addresses) associated with a person, such as phone number, email, or messaging service. Multiple telecommunication addresses might be provided.
The organisation of which this organisation forms a part
